captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem
Blitzcrank is a mix between a pure tank, a melee fighter, and a burst mage, depending on what your team needs.
Overall, he excels at disruption and literally grabbing free kills for your team!
Blitzcrank’s passive is Mana Barrier. When Blitzcrank gets low on health, he gains a temporary shield based off his current mana.
Blitzcrank does not lose any mana in the process, but if you happen to be empty when it activates, you won’t get much of a shield.
Rocket Grab sends out a skill-shot nuke which damages and stuns the first enemy it hits. Immediately after hitting, it pulls the enemy to you.
Overdrive gives Blitzcrank bonus movement and attack speed for a few seconds.
Power Fist causes Blitzcrank’s next basic attack to deal bonus damage and knock the target into the air.
Using this ability will reset your attack timer, so using it immediately after landing an attack will give you more damage output.
Static Field is Blitzcrank’s ultimate. Passively, it deals damage to a random nearby enemy every few seconds.
On activation, Blitzcrank damages and silences all nearby enemies, but deactivates the passive until it cools down.
At the start of the game, always check to see if you want to push.
Check the scoreboard to see if they have a jungler and use Clairvoyance to see where he’s starting.
One great Clairvoyance spot is right here. It lets you see champions setting up for the golem, wolves, or the brush to the right.
Spotting Akali I walk up and pull her into my team with Rocket Grab, picking up first blood.
At level 2 try to play aggressively in lane. I don’t want to Rocket Grab right away because I need Alistar’s attacks for damage output.
Instead I walk up for Power Fist, and then Rocket Grab after.
I actually used Rocket Grab too soon because we don’t kill him until after we all Flash. But we still pick up the kill thanks to teamwork and good ability use.
Warding the brush in your lane can be extremely powerful.
Here Teemo ducks in for what he thinks will be a safe place to harass, but now that I know where he is, I land a Rocket Grab.
I knock him up with Power Fist and chase with Overdrive once he flashes away.
Because Overdrive lasts much longer than Move Quick, I know I can keep up a continued chase and land another Power Fist to pick up the kill.
Be patient when using Rocket Grab. I see a fight in mid and chase with Overdrive.
I prepare to grab an opponent with Rocket Grab, but I’m not sure I’m in range.
Because of my extra movement speed, Brand is afraid to take a turn straight down.
He heads to the back side of the turret, which means he has no room to juke.
This is the perfect opportunity to use Rocket Grab. I hit him, immediately land Power Fist, and on the way down activate Static Field.
He basically has no chance to react and goes from full HP to death.
In bottom lane we push down a turret and start chasing Akali toward her base.
I Flash to ensure I land Rocket Grab which keeps her out of Twilight Shroud.
Static Field and Power Fist keep her from retreating while Alistar knocks her around.
I run from Nocturne because I know he can kill me, but when he turns to Alistar I turn back to disrupt his chase.
Because of my cooldown reduction though runes, masteries, and items, I’m able to knock up Nocturne twice, letting Alistar live with just a sliver of health.
I want to reiterate that holding onto Rocket Grab is valuable.
We try to catch Pantheon right at level 1 for an early First Blood, so I Flash in to take him down.
Look how he Flashes before I even finish casting Rocket Grab.
If I had just waited a half second, I could have grabbed him after the Flash and picked up the kill.
We can see in a later fight that this tactic really works well against this Pantheon player.
Right as I reach max range, he keeps walking back and forth hoping to juke me.
Instead, I just walk farther and farther forward, landing the Rocket Grab even despite his Flash.
I see Pantheon and Wukong present themselves, so I grab one in and unload, forcing him out of the fight.
I make the mistake of trying to chase him, which gets me caught by everyone else.
I knock up Master Yi and keep running, but as soon as Shen lands Shadow Dash, I know I can get the kill, so I Rocket Grab into Power Fist, taking him down.
As Kennen chases me, I try to catch him around the corner with Power Fist, but my team picks up the kill anyway.
Disruption is huge on Blitzcrank.
I get into a teamfight late, but my position allows me to Rocket Grab Pantheon away from the battle, locking him up for about half of it.
I run in and pop Static Field because it will hit literally every member on the enemy team. Sure enough, we clean up three kills in a row.
In another teamfight, I go for a Rocket Grab while standing on one of Teemo’s mushrooms.
I probably could have gone for Pantheon, so it was a mistake to grab Galio. Thankfully he does waste his ultimate, so the fight continues.
Immediately I head over to their most important target, Pantheon.
I interrupt Heartseeker Strike with Power Fist and lock him up with another Power Fist into Rocket Grab.
Note that I don’t activate Static Field. If you’re only fighting a single target, you do more damage by letting it passively hurt targets for you.
Only activate it if you need a burst of damage at the end.
For runes I take armor penetration marks, flat armor seals, flat cooldown reduction glyphs, and armor penetration quintessences.
This setup allows me to deal tons of damage with Power Fist and Sheen, survive some harassment in lane, and general utility with cooldown reduction.
My masteries are 0/9/21, taking pretty standard masteries, specifically improving Clairvoyance and Flash.
I take one point in Rocket Grab at level 1 and leave it there until level 14.
My first priority is to max Power Fist with a point in Overdrive by level 3.
Lowering the cooldown on Power Fist to use it multiple times per fight is extremely important.
Maxing Overdrive second allows me to more easily chase down my enemies.
For items, I open with a Sapphire Crystal and two Health Potions.
Ionian Boots of Lucidity and Sheen are pretty much guaranteed buys right after.
Depending on how the game is going, I’ll add more offense with Trinity Force, magic defense with Banshee’s Veil, or physical defense with Randuin’s Omen.
Finally, I end up grabbing more damage output with Infinity Edge and Bloodthirster.
Thanks for tuning into the Blitzcrank Champion Spotlight.
Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel up top and leave us your thoughts in the comments below.

comments.text:
+Thanatos Anima Right, so we have a DOTA player here.
Let's look at the facts;
Blitzcrank costs 3150 IP.
If you play your games right, you can get 200 IP per round.
And, if you're playing LOL because you think it's FUN, you'll continue.
So a total of 16 rounds shouldn't be "depressing" or "grinding" if you 
enjoy LOL.
So it basically takes 16 rounds to purchase a Blitzcrank. 
And, if you're playing it right, you'll push down Co-op VS AIs Nexuses 
before the 20 minute mark.
Let's just assume everything is 19 minutes.

19 x 16 = 190 + 95 + 19 = 209 + 95 = 214.

214 minutes.
Which equal 3 hours and 34 minutes.
Would you kindly define a million years, Dota player?

I don't dislike Dota players, but I hate it when LOL OR Dota players come 
in and go "oh look your game is so much inferior to ours because *certain 
aspect of game*."

comments.author: Joker Protegie

comments.text:
I believe that Blitzcrank needs to be changed in some way based on the idea 
that being hit by a rocket grab should not mean that you immediately die 
with no chance of escape or survival. Blitzcrank has the most unforgiving 
kit of any champion in the game.  You can say, 'oh, all you need to do is 
avoid the rocket grab.' but two facts make that statement flawed, first, 
the rocket grab is a wide, long ranged projectile that has no wind up time, 
practically instantaneous.  second, by making that point, you are saying, 
oh just don't die and you will win.  there is playing around a champion's 
skill set, and there is having to outright avoid an instant death, because 
one you are pulled, you are knocked up and silenced, and it's only 16 
seconds before another ally goes down.﻿
comments.author: Sarosetsu

comments.text:
+TheBisasam22 hiding behind minions is key against blitz, HOWEVER! there is 
another most played noob champ that nullify this protection. Caitlyn. Her 
basic attack range force you to stay away from minions making blitz go 
around bushes to grab forcing you to either move in caitlyns range or get 
grabbed then knocked.
Blitz early kit is already op as an insta death as you will have to predict 
his hooks which is all the time while also avoiding getting into caitlyns 
range, plus blitz passive shield comes up far to fast compared to other 
champions like Aatrox or Zac who gets revived but not fully and they can't 
move during this long period of time while blitz shield can protect him 
from an entire team and escape. You think anivia's passive is annoying, 
imagine it coming back after each battle and triggered as he can still use 
abilities moves under the turret instead of lying still allowing you to 
actually kill him.
comments.author: magnusm4

comments.text:
+TheBisasam22 Relying on a team is the basis of any support, it's a matter 
of being able to instantly position your enemy to be mowed down by your 
team that makes blitzcrank so frustrating
comments.author: Sarosetsu

comments.text:
I think the kit of Blitzcrank is really balanced. His q may seem unfair, 
but while laining it can be easily avoided by standing behind minions. 
Also, if Blitz doesnt hit his grab well, he is pretty much useless, because 
for every other ability you need to be close to the enemies, what means you 
can die easily and your rocket grab becomes a lot weaker. Also, no chance 
of escape is wrong. Yes, Blitz makes enemies use their flash like no one 
else, but later in the game a grab on their tank can make you loose. Also, 
if you dont build heavy ap, you are weak in a 1v1 and have to completely 
rely on your team.
